data.title: Crash while decoding small MP3 file on Android
data.body:
Reported by @ryanxia2016

> When call playEffect with same SMALL mp3 files, game crashed.
> Crash Device : ASUS ZENPHONE2 (Android 5.0 x86)
> 
> COCOS Version 3.3 with this PR merged.
> 
> The game worked right at most time, but if it hits the specified mp3 files, then crash occur.
> 
> attachment is the mp3 file, which will cause crash.
> [crash_voice.mp3.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/377483/crash_voice.mp3.zip)

is called

github issue #16139

data.title: Fix typos in documentation and comments
data.body: This pull request fixes several minor typos/mistakes in documentation and comments.

data.title: cocos2dx-v3.12-lua Sprite:playAnimationOnce(animation, args) blinks
data.body:
cocos2dx-v3.12
lua project
cocos/framework/extends/SpriteEx.lua
function Sprite:playAnimationOnce(animation, args)

```
local showDelay = args.showDelay or 0
if showDelay then
    self:setVisible(false)
    actions[#actions + 1] = cc.DelayTime:create(showDelay)
    actions[#actions + 1] = cc.Show:create()
end
```

showDelay is always not-nil, it'll make sprite setVisible(false) always, then the sprite would blink once.

If I want Role to do an Attack animation, the sequence would be like:
Blink -> Attack
That was so ugly.

change `local showDelay = args.showDelay or 0` to `local showDelay = args.showDelay` would be OK.

data.title: Try to use 'MediaCodec' to decode audio to PCM buffer
data.body:
Currently, we're using `OpenSLES` API for decoding audio to PCM buffer on Android.
The decode speed isn't very fast.
Maybe we should try another way to do the decode stuff.

Please refer to the section `Decode audio to PCM` at https://developer.android.com/ndk/guides/audio/opensl-for-android.html

![screen shot 2016-07-21 at 17 10 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/493372/17017519/359d298e-4f66-11e6-9adf-e4c83a09e135.png)

data.title: FPS isn't stable on OSX
data.body:
### How to Reproduce?

Just pull the latest code of v3 branch, run `cpp-empty-test Mac` in Xcode.
You will see the fps label at left-bottom of window displayed between 54fps to 58fps.

@minggo has checked that it also exists in v3.12.

data.body: Implement willPlayBackgroundMusic(), so that we can check if music is already playing in another app.

data.title: Fix bugs with music not resuming when iOS app is reactivated
data.body:
The audio manager's automatic resign/active behaviour aims to pause the music when the app goes to the background, and resume it again when it comes back to the foreground.

This used to work in older versions of cocos, but appears to have been broken by https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/26a04b38f2bd879d5705b38f55470f9fd9423df6

This change pauses instead of stops the music on resign.

The [audioSource stop] causes the music to be stopped, and therefore it fails to resume later on a call to [audioSource resume], due to the addition of the if (!stopped) check in resume added in https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/26a04b38f2bd879d5705b38f55470f9fd9423df6

data.title: Fix typo in constant name
data.body:
Hi, this PR fixes spelling mistakes I found while reading. I guess `BATCH_TRIAGCOMMAND_RESEVER_SIZE` should be `BATCH_TRIAGCOMMAND_RESERVED_SIZE` (or `BATCH_TRIAGCOMMAND_RESERVE_SIZE`).

Thanks!

data.title: [UIButton]contentSize is still ZERO after Button::loadTextureNormal
fix label text formatter right alignment
[ios] Random crash in alGenBuffers(AudioCache::readDataTask) at startup
new android project crash in android 5.0.2 device (Nexus 7) when use 3.12
data.body:
This is the process to see this bug:

```
1. cocos new test_project -p com.test.test -l cpp
2. cd test_project
3. python /Users/jun/Code/cocos2d-x-3.12/tools/cocos2d-console/bin/cocos.py  compile -p android --android-studio --ap android-15 --ndk-mode release --mode release  --output-dir .
4. adb install test_project-release-signed.apk
```

When run this test app in android 5.0.2 device (Nexus 7) , it will crash!  but in android 4.4 and android 6.0, it was no problem.

The ndk version is r11c

data.title: [v3 branch, Android]: 'cocos new' command doesn't generate the project correctly
data.body:
If you do this

```
git clone https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x.git
cd cocos2d-x
python download-deps.py
git submodule update --init
./setup.py
```

When you create a new project with
`cocos new -l cpp TEST`
The folder `cocos/audio/android` (I guess also `cocos/platform/android`) does not contain files of (merged) PR #15875 
This makes the compiler to fail on Android.
It is need the manual copy of the mentioned folders for now! :-(
